name: Theories that are indirectly self-defeating
description: In this episode we discuss Parfit's analysis of the S, or Self-interest Theory and its inherent fallacies. We try to disambiguate Parfit's insistence that S leads to the very irrationality that it aims to resolve, and the moral consequences of there being an S in he first place; if indeed such a thing were to exist (as Parfit himself denies).

name: Practical Dilemmas
description: Having revealed some of the holes in Self-interest Theory, Parfit turns his attention towards conseqeuntialism. His critique explores some of the logical fallicies that surface in the face of consequentialism, including the free rider problem.

name: Five mistakes in moral mathematics
description: The most technical episode to date, this week we discuss what Parfit considered to be the fatal flaw of reasoning that gave rise to many of the theories that he takes issue with. Through the moralistic lens of altruism, we lay the bedrock how Parfit's analysis appeals to our intuitions.
